config

Central configuration file (used in surrogate.py, vs_*.py) for metropolitan-network usecase. The goal is to maximize the number of request the network stack can fulfill by tuning the number of memory qubits allocated in each node. The network stack is simulated using the package SeQUeNCe and an adpated run script simulation.py of a sequence-toolbox script.

class usecase_metropolitan.config.Config[source]

Bases: object

Configuration class for setting up and running simulations with specific parameters.

vals

A dictionary containing default simulation configuration values. - ‘network_config_file’ (str): Path to the network configuration file. - ‘N’ (int): Simulation sample size. - ‘total_time’ (float): Total simulation time.

Type:

dict

name

The name identifier for the configuration.

Type:

str

sim

The simulation function to be used.

Type:

function

args

Parsed command-line arguments.

Type:

argparse.Namespace

rng

A random number generator initialized with a seed.

Type:

numpy.random.Generator

set_variables() → None[source]

Defines variables and their bounds for the simulation based on the network topology.

simobjective(simulation, kwargs: dict) → tuple[source]

Runs the simulation with the given parameters and calculates objectives.

Parameters:

  • simulation (function) – The simulation function to be run.

  • kwargs (dict) – The keyword arguments to be passed to the simulation function.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • objectives (float): The calculated objective value.

  • objectives_std (float): The standard deviation of the objective.

  • raw (float): The raw mean result from the simulation.

Return type:

tuple

simulation

Adapted run script of [sequence-toolbox](https://github.com/sequence-toolbox/Chicago-metropolitan-quantum-network/blob/master/sec5.4-two-memory-distribution-policies/run.py)
